JD Vance positions himself as heir of the MAGA movement
subhead: The US vice president has made his mark in what is often a thankless role, railing against immigration, placing faith at the heart of his message and playing his part in diplomacy. He is seeking to make his candidacy for 2028 unavoidable – without upsetting Donald Trump.
byline: By Piotr Smolar (Oxford (Mississippi, United States) special correspondent)

title: Louvre heist suspects believed to be small-time criminals, says Paris prosecutor

France's new 'unproductive wealth' tax reflects a limited adjustment
subhead: MPs approved on Friday a modification of the real estate wealth tax. Its base was broadened, but the tax rate was reduced by a third for the very wealthy. Its yield remains unclear.

title: UK police arrest two British nationals in mass train stabbing that wounded 10
subhead: The men in custody were 'a 32-year-old male, a Black British national, and a 35-year-old man, a British national of Caribbean descent,' the Transport Police superintendent said, adding that there is nothing to suggest a terrorist incident at this stage.
byline: Le Monde with AP and AFP

title: Sinner wins first Paris Masters, reclaims No. 1 ranking
subhead: The Italian beat Canadian 9th seed Felix Auger-Aliassime 6-4, 7-6 (7/4) in Paris on Sunday.

title: The Orient Express pulls up in Paris: An opulent journey into the 1920s
subhead: The legendary luxury train is making a stop at Paris's Musée des Arts Décoratifs until spring. As part of the major exhibition dedicated to the centenary of Art Deco, three life-size mock-ups of the new Orient Express, set to return to service soon, are on display.

subhead: The United Nations Security Council adopted a resolution on Friday that recognizes Rabat's autonomy plan as the main reference point in the search for a solution to a conflict that has long poisoned the geopolitics of North Africa.
byline: By Alexandre Aublanc (Casablanca (Morocco), correspondent) and Frédéric Bobin

title: Sentences over red hand graffiti on Paris Shoah Memorial handed down in 'unprecedented' trial
subhead: Four Bulgarian nationals, one of whom is still at large, received sentences ranging from two to four years in prison amid suspicions of foreign interference. The damage was committed 'because the victim belonged to a particular religion,' according to the Paris Criminal Court.

title: Asia-Pacific countries torn between risks from both US and China
subhead: Uncertainties created by Donald Trump have become the decisive factor in the positioning of countries around the Pacific Rim, who gathered for a two-day summit in Gyeongju, South Korea.
byline: By Harold Thibault (Beijing (China) correspondent) and Philippe Mesmer (Gyeongju, (South Korea) special correspondent)
